titulo_feria_persuasion_2.texto: The Persuasion Fair 2 - The Return of Biases
titulo_feria_persuasion_2.fonetica: ðə pərˈsweɪʒən fɛr tu - ðə rɪˈtɜrn ʌv ˈbaɪəsɪz

un_ano_despues.texto: One year later, the Great Persuasion Fair returns.
un_ano_despues.fonetica: wʌn jɪr ˈleɪtər, ðə ɡreɪt pərˈsweɪʒən fɛr rɪˈtɜrnz

escena2_puesto_brillo.fonetica: sin tu - ðə ˈʃaɪni stɔl (ˈheɪloʊ ɪˈfɛkt)

vendedora_simpatica.texto: A very friendly vendor offers shoes.
vendedora_simpatica.fonetica: ə ˈvɛri ˈfrɛndli ˈvɛndər ˈɔfərz ʃuz

todos_piensan_halo.texto: Everyone thinks: "If she's so nice, the shoes must be good!"
todos_piensan_halo.fonetica: ˈɛvriwʌn θɪŋks ɪf ʃiz soʊ naɪs, ðə ʃuz mʌst bi ɡʊd

explicacion_efecto_halo.texto: The halo effect makes a positive quality make us assume everything else is good too.
explicacion_efecto_halo.fonetica: ðə ˈheɪloʊ ɪˈfɛkt meɪks ə ˈpɑzətɪv ˈkwɑləti meɪk ʌs əˈsum ˈɛvriθɪŋ ɛls ɪz ɡʊd tu

escena3_experto_youtube.fonetica: sin θri - ðə ˈjuˌtub ˈɛkspɜrt (ˈdʌnɪŋ ˈkruɡər ɪˈfɛkt)

joven_tutorial.texto: A young man says: "I watched a tutorial, now I'm a hypnosis master."
joven_tutorial.fonetica: ə jʌŋ mæn sɛz aɪ wɑʧt ə tuˈtɔriəl, naʊ aɪm ə hɪpˈnoʊsɪs ˈmæstər

hipnotizado_el_mismo.texto: Three minutes later, he's hypnotized... himself.
hipnotizado_el_mismo.fonetica: θri ˈmɪnəts ˈleɪtər, hiz ˈhɪpnəˌtaɪzd... himˈsɛlf

explicacion_dunning_kruger.texto: The Dunning-Kruger effect occurs when someone with little experience believes they know more than they actually do.
explicacion_dunning_kruger.fonetica: ðə ˈdʌnɪŋ ˈkruɡər ɪˈfɛkt əˈkɜrz wɛn ˈsʌmˌwʌn wɪθ ˈlɪtl ɪkˈspɪriəns bɪˈlivz ðeɪ noʊ mɔr ðæn ðeɪ ˈækʧuəli du

escena4_puerta_cara.texto: Scene 4 - The Impossible Sweets Stall (Door-in-the-Face Technique)
escena4_puerta_cara.fonetica: sin fɔr - ðə ɪmˈpɑsəbəl swits stɔl (dɔr ɪn ðə feɪs tɛkˈnik)

vendedor_cien_cajas.texto: The vendor: "Will you buy 100 boxes of candy from me?"
vendedor_cien_cajas.fonetica: ðə ˈvɛndər wɪl ju baɪ wʌn ˈhʌndrəd ˈbɑksɪz ʌv ˈkændi frʌm mi

cliente_no_loco.fonetica: ðə ˈkʌstəmər noʊ weɪ, jʊr ˈkreɪzi

explicacion_puerta_cara.texto: The door-in-the-face technique asks for something exaggerated first. After it's rejected, the second request seems reasonable.
explicacion_puerta_cara.fonetica: ðə dɔr ɪn ðə feɪs tɛkˈnik æsks fər ˈsʌmθɪŋ ɪɡˈzæʤəˌreɪtɪd fɜrst ˈæftər ɪts rɪˈʤɛktɪd, ðə ˈsɛkənd rɪˈkwɛst simz ˈrizənəbəl

escena5_sesgo_escasez.fonetica: sin faɪv - ðə læst ˈmɪnəts saɪn (ˈskɛrsəti ˈbaɪəs)

cartel_ultimo_lote.texto: A blinking sign: "Today only, final batch!"
cartel_ultimo_lote.fonetica: ə ˈblɪŋkɪŋ saɪn təˈdeɪ ˈoʊnli, ˈfaɪnəl bæʧ

gente_corre_comprar.texto: Even though there are 500 boxes, people run to buy.
gente_corre_comprar.fonetica: ˈivən ðoʊ ðɛr ɑr faɪv ˈhʌndrəd ˈbɑksɪz, ˈpipəl rʌn tu baɪ

explicacion_escasez.texto: The scarcity bias makes us value more what we believe is about to run out.
explicacion_escasez.fonetica: ðə ˈskɛrsəti ˈbaɪəs meɪks ʌs ˈvælju mɔr wɑt wi bɪˈliv ɪz əˈbaʊt tu rʌn aʊt

escena6_efecto_ikea.fonetica: sin sɪks - ðə ˈfɜrnɪʧər ˈwɜrkˌʃɑp (ɪˈkeɪə ɪˈfɛkt)

cliente_arma_silla.texto: Each customer assembles their own chair.
cliente_arma_silla.fonetica: iʧ ˈkʌstəmər əˈsɛmbəlz ðɛr oʊn ʧɛr

sillas_chuecas.texto: They all end up crooked, but they happily shout: "Masterpiece!"
sillas_chuecas.fonetica: ðeɪ ɔl ɛnd ʌp ˈkrʊkɪd, bʌt ðeɪ ˈhæpəli ʃaʊt ˈmæstərˌpis

explicacion_ikea.texto: The IKEA effect says we value more the things we make ourselves, even if they come out crooked.
explicacion_ikea.fonetica: ðə ɪˈkeɪə ɪˈfɛkt sɛz wi ˈvælju mɔr ðə θɪŋz wi meɪk ˌaʊərˈsɛlvz, ˈivən ɪf ðeɪ kʌm aʊt ˈkrʊkɪd

escena7_reciprocidad.fonetica: sin ˈsɛvən - hɪr, ɪts fri (ˌrɛsəˈprɑsəti ˈbaɪəs)

vendedor_muestras.texto: A vendor gives out free samples.
vendedor_muestras.fonetica: ə ˈvɛndər ɡɪvz aʊt fri ˈsæmpəlz

vendedor_me_compras.texto: Then he asks: "Will you buy something from me?"
vendedor_me_compras.fonetica: ðɛn hi æsks wɪl ju baɪ ˈsʌmθɪŋ frʌm mi

clientes_dicen_si.texto: And most people say yes, out of obligation.
clientes_dicen_si.fonetica: ænd moʊst ˈpipəl seɪ jɛs, aʊt ʌv ˌɑbləˈɡeɪʃən

explicacion_reciprocidad.texto: The reciprocity bias pushes us to return favors, even when we didn't ask for them.
explicacion_reciprocidad.fonetica: ðə ˌrɛsəˈprɑsəti ˈbaɪəs ˈpʊʃɪz ʌs tu rɪˈtɜrn ˈfeɪvərz, ˈivən wɛn wi dɪdənt æsk fɔr ðəm

escena8_sesgo_autoridad.fonetica: sin eɪt - ðə məˈʤɪʃənz stɔl (əˈθɔrəti ˈbaɪəs)

hombre_bata_blanca.texto: A man in a white coat announces: "I'm a scientist, this juice cures everything."
hombre_bata_blanca.fonetica: ə mæn ɪn ə waɪt koʊt əˈnaʊnsɪz aɪm ə ˈsaɪəntɪst, ðɪs ʤus kjʊrz ˈɛvriθɪŋ

gente_compra_limonada.texto: People buy without hesitation... even though it's lemonade.
gente_compra_limonada.fonetica: ˈpipəl baɪ wɪˈðaʊt ˌhɛzəˈteɪʃən... ˈivən ðoʊ ɪts ˈlɛməˌneɪd

explicacion_autoridad.texto: The authority bias leads us to believe more in someone who seems expert or wears a uniform.
explicacion_autoridad.fonetica: ðə əˈθɔrəti ˈbaɪəs lidz ʌs tu bɪˈliv mɔr ɪn ˈsʌmˌwʌn hu simz ˈɛkspɜrt oʊr wɛrz ə ˈjunəˌfɔrm

escena9_efecto_contraste.fonetica: sin naɪn - ðə dɪˈzɜrt ˌkɑmpəˈtɪʃən (ˈkɑntræst ɪˈfɛkt)

jurado_pastel_malo.texto: The judges try a terrible cake first.
jurado_pastel_malo.fonetica: ðə ˈʤʌʤɪz traɪ ə ˈtɛrəbəl keɪk fɜrst

pastel_normal_celestial.texto: The next cake, just average, seems heavenly to them.
pastel_normal_celestial.fonetica: ðə nɛkst keɪk, ʤʌst ˈævərɪʤ, simz ˈhɛvənli tu ðɛm

explicacion_contraste.texto: The contrast effect makes something seem better or worse depending on what it's compared to.
explicacion_contraste.fonetica: ðə ˈkɑntræst ɪˈfɛkt meɪks ˈsʌmθɪŋ sim ˈbɛtər oʊr wɜrs dɪˈpɛndɪŋ ɑn wɑt ɪts kəmˈpɛrd tu

escena10_tecnica_si_pero.fonetica: sin tɛn - jɛs, bʌt (jɛs, bʌt tɛkˈnik)

empanadas_grasosas.fonetica: jʊr ˌɛmpəˈnɑdəz ɑr ə bɪt ˈɡrisi

respuesta_si_pero.texto: "Yes, I know... but that gives them their unique flavor."
respuesta_si_pero.fonetica: jɛs, aɪ noʊ... bʌt ðæt ɡɪvz ðɛm ðɛr juˈnik ˈfleɪvər

explicacion_si_pero.texto: The 'yes, but' technique acknowledges the objection and transforms it into a positive argument.
explicacion_si_pero.fonetica: ðə jɛs, bʌt tɛkˈnik ækˈnɑlɪʤɪz ði əbˈʤɛkʃən ænd trænsˈfɔrmz ɪt ˈɪntu ə ˈpɑzətɪv ˈɑrɡjəmənt

escena11_pygmalion.fonetica: sin ɪˈlɛvən - ði ˌɑptəˈmɪstɪk ˈtitʃər (pɪɡˈmeɪliən ɪˈfɛkt)

escena12_efecto_zeigarnik.fonetica: sin twɛlv - ðə pərˈsɪstənt ˈvɛndər (zaɪˈɡɑrnɪk ɪˈfɛkt)

cliente_piensa_regresar.texto: The customer leaves thinking: "What if I come back tomorrow?"
cliente_piensa_regresar.fonetica: ðə ˈkʌstəmər livz ˈθɪŋkɪŋ wʌt ɪf aɪ kʌm bæk təˈmɑroʊ

explicacion_zeigarnik.texto: The Zeigarnik effect says we remember better what we leave unfinished.
explicacion_zeigarnik.fonetica: ðə zaɪˈɡɑrnɪk ɪˈfɛkt sɛz wi rɪˈmɛmbər ˈbɛtər wɑt wi liv ʌnˈfɪnɪʃt

escena13_reencuadre.texto: Scene 13 - The Two Ice Creams (Reframing or Framing)
escena13_reencuadre.fonetica: sin ˈθɜrˌtin - ðə tu ˈaɪs krimz (riˈfreɪmɪŋ oʊr ˈfreɪmɪŋ)

cartel_90_libre.fonetica: saɪn tu - ˈnaɪnti pərˈsɛnt fæt fri

explicacion_reencuadre.texto: Reframing changes perception just by how the information is presented.
explicacion_reencuadre.fonetica: riˈfreɪmɪŋ ˈʧeɪnʤɪz pərˈsɛpʃən ʤʌst baɪ haʊ ði ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən ɪz prɪˈzɛntɪd

escena14_memoria.texto: Scene 14 - The Memory Contest (Primacy and Recency Effect)
escena14_memoria.fonetica: sin ˈfɔrˌtin - ðə ˈmɛməri ˈkɑntɛst (ˈpraɪməsi ænd ˈrisənsi ɪˈfɛkt)

recuerdan_primera_ultima.texto: Everyone only remembers the first... and the last.
recuerdan_primera_ultima.fonetica: ˈɛvriwʌn ˈoʊnli rɪˈmɛmbərz ðə fɜrst... ænd ðə læst

explicacion_primacia_recencia.texto: We remember the beginning and end of a list better. The middle is quickly forgotten.
explicacion_primacia_recencia.fonetica: wi rɪˈmɛmbər ðə bɪˈɡɪnɪŋ ænd ɛnd ʌv ə lɪst ˈbɛtər. ðə ˈmɪdl ɪz ˈkwɪkli fərˈɡɑtən

escena15_sesgo_negatividad.fonetica: sin ˈfɪfˌtin - ðə ˈpɛsəˌmɪzəm ɡrup (ˌnɛɡəˈtɪvəti ˈbaɪəs)

resenas_buenas_malas.texto: One good review, two average ones, and one bad one.
resenas_buenas_malas.fonetica: wʌn ɡʊd rɪˈvju, tu ˈævərɪʤ wʌnz, ænd wʌn bæd wʌn

gente_queda_mala.texto: Which one do people remember? The bad one, of course.
gente_queda_mala.fonetica: wɪʧ wʌn du ˈpipəl rɪˈmɛmbər ðə bæd wʌn, ʌv kɔrs

explicacion_negatividad.texto: The negativity bias makes us give more importance to the bad than to the good.
explicacion_negatividad.fonetica: ðə ˌnɛɡəˈtɪvəti ˈbaɪəs meɪks ʌs ɡɪv mɔr ɪmˈpɔrtəns tu ðə bæd ðæn tu ðə ɡʊd

escena16_arrastre_emocional.texto: Scene 16 - The Charismatic Megaphone Guy (Emotional Contagion Effect)
escena16_arrastre_emocional.fonetica: sin ˈsɪkˌstin - ðə ˌkɛrɪzˈmætɪk ˈmɛɡəˌfoʊn ɡaɪ (ɪˈmoʊʃənəl kənˈteɪʤən ɪˈfɛkt)

cuenta_historia_reir.texto: Before selling, he tells a story that makes people laugh.
cuenta_historia_reir.fonetica: bɪˈfɔr ˈsɛlɪŋ, hi tɛlz ə ˈstɔri ðæt meɪks ˈpipəl læf

ahora_mi_curso.texto: Then he says: "And now, my course!"
ahora_mi_curso.fonetica: ðɛn hi sɛz ænd naʊ, maɪ kɔrs

explicacion_arrastre_emocional.texto: The emotional contagion effect shows that positive emotion before asking for something increases acceptance.
explicacion_arrastre_emocional.fonetica: ðə ɪˈmoʊʃənəl kənˈteɪʤən ɪˈfɛkt ʃoʊz ðət ˈpɑzətɪv ɪˈmoʊʃən ˈbɪˈfɔr ˈæskɪŋ fər ˈsʌmθɪŋ ɪnˈkrizɪz ækˈsɛptəns

escena17_bandwagon_2.texto: Scene 17 - The "Everyone's Doing It" Group (Bandwagon Effect 2.0)
escena17_bandwagon_2.fonetica: sin ˈsɛvənˌtin - ðə ˈɛvriwʌnz ˈduɪŋ ɪt ɡrup (ˈbændˌwæɡən ɪˈfɛkt tu poɪnt ˈoʊ)

nueva_bebida_llega.texto: A new drink arrives at the fair.
nueva_bebida_llega.fonetica: ə nu drɪŋk əˈraɪvz æt ðə fɛr

todos_hacen_fila.texto: Nobody has tried it, but since everyone is in line... you join too.
todos_hacen_fila.fonetica: ˈnoʊˌbɑdi hæz traɪd ɪt, bʌt sɪns ˈɛvriwʌn ɪz ɪn laɪn... ju ʤɔɪn tu

explicacion_bandwagon.texto: The bandwagon effect (or herd effect) makes us imitate the behavior of the majority.
explicacion_bandwagon.fonetica: ðə ˈbændˌwæɡən ɪˈfɛkt oʊr hɜrd ɪˈfɛkt meɪks ʌs ˈɪməˌteɪt ðə bɪˈheɪvjər ʌv ðə məˈʤɑrəti

escena18_ilusion_control.texto: Scene 18 - The Control Illusionist (Illusion of Control)
escena18_ilusion_control.fonetica: sin ˈeɪˌtin - ðə kənˈtroʊl ɪˈluʒənɪst (ɪˈluʒən ʌv kənˈtroʊl)

jugador_lanza_dados.texto: A player throws dice harder "to get lucky."
jugador_lanza_dados.fonetica: ə ˈpleɪər θroʊz daɪs ˈhɑrdər tu ɡɛt ˈlʌki

explicacion_ilusion_control.texto: The illusion of control makes us believe we can influence random things.
explicacion_ilusion_control.fonetica: ðə ɪˈluʒən ʌv kənˈtroʊl meɪks ʌs bɪˈliv wi kæn ˈɪnfluəns ˈrændəm θɪŋz

escena19_sesgo_retrospectiva.texto: Scene 19 - The "I Knew It All Along" Wise Guy (Hindsight Bias)
escena19_sesgo_retrospectiva.fonetica: sin ˈnaɪnˌtin - ðə aɪ nu ɪt ɔl əˈlɔŋ waɪz ɡaɪ (ˈhaɪndˌsaɪt ˈbaɪəs)

perdio_rifa.texto: After losing the raffle he says: "I knew I wasn't going to win."
perdio_rifa.fonetica: ˈæftər ˈluzɪŋ ðə ˈræfəl hi sɛz aɪ nu aɪ ˈwɑzənt ˈɡoʊɪŋ tu wɪn

explicacion_retrospectiva.texto: The hindsight bias makes us believe we "already knew" what happened, when we really didn't.
explicacion_retrospectiva.fonetica: ðə ˈhaɪndˌsaɪt ˈbaɪəs meɪks ʌs bɪˈliv wi ˈɔlˈrɛdi nu wɑt ˈhæpənd, wɛn wi ˈrɪəli dɪdənt

escena20_final_dia.fonetica: sin ˈtwɛnti - ɛnd ʌv ðə deɪ

todos_rien_aprenden.texto: Everyone laughs, learns, and sells better.
todos_rien_aprenden.fonetica: ˈɛvriwʌn læfs, lɜrnz, ænd sɛlz ˈbɛtər

don_paco_escoba.texto: And Mr. Paco says: "With so many biases, even my broom sold itself!" 😂
don_paco_escoba.fonetica: ænd ˈmɪstər ˈpɑkoʊ sɛz wɪð soʊ ˈmɛni ˈbaɪəsɪz, ˈivən maɪ brum soʊld ɪtˈsɛlf
